pages.text: An old woman made a gingerbread boy. She gave him raisin eyes and a smile. "Someone will love to eat you!" she said. She put him in the oven to bake. But when she opened the oven door, the gingerbread boy jumped out! "You can't catch me!" he cried. And he ran outside!

The old woman ran after him. "Come back!" But the gingerbread boy just laughed. "Run, run, as fast as you can! You can't catch me, I'm the gingerbread man!" He ran past everyone he saw. The old man tried to catch him. The cow tried too. But they couldn't catch him!

The gingerbread boy came to a river. He couldn't swim! A fox was sitting by the water. "I won't eat you," said the fox. "But I can help you across. Jump on my back!" The gingerbread boy jumped on. But halfway across, the fox tossed him up and‚ÄîSNAP!‚Äîate him in one bite! THE END "Don't be too sure of yourself!" said the fox. Compound Words: gingerbread, something, someone, everyone, anyone, outside, inside, cannot, himself, yourself Contractions: can't, won't, don't, couldn't, didn't, I'm, he's Talk About the Story: 1. Why did the gingerbread boy run away? 2. What did he say to everyone? ("You can't catch me!") 3. How did the fox trick him? 4. What's the lesson? (Don't be overconfident!) Story Source: Folktale (Public Domain) BedrockELA Adaptation: February 2026 For use with: BedrockELA 1st Grade Curriculum, Lessons 68-70 **Mountain Connection:** Billy says, "Pride comes before a fall! Stay humble!" �‚õ∞Ô∏è
